text: [Music]
I think that what we need to move to is
government assuring that everybody has
basic health coverage that doesn't mean
it has to be a Canadian Single Payer
style system which is often what the
conservative conard is about this kind
of change but you can have government
make sure that the funding is available
say for uh subsidies for low-income
people who need help buying a private
plan but everybody has to have access to
group coverage you can't leave people in
the individual Market because as we know
if you're in the individual market and
you've got any kind of illness yourself
you're not going to be able to get
insurance or people will try and charge
you $50,000 a year which is obviously
the same as having no insurance but
there again there are models abroad
Holland Switzerland where you've got
Market friendly Universal Health
Coverage where essentially the
government makes sure that people who
need it have a voucher to help them Buy
from among competing private plans and
everyone has access to group rates and
it you know again in theory it's one of
those things that's common sense but
there's a lot of vested interest built
up around the current dead idea and I
think the pressure of events
economically has gotten us to a point
where we're going to revisit that the
next few years
